title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user is left to figure out how to save the changes or discard them, and the error message does not provide clear instructions. Furthermore, the dialog is titled "Error". The expected behavior should be to provide clear options for saving or discarding the changes.
OB: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The error message states: "Source page is dirty." The user is left to figure out how to save the changes or discard them, and the error message does not provide clear instructions.
EB: The expected behavior is for the editor to display a dialog with clear options for saving or discarding the changes when attempting to switch back to the Layout view. The error message should also provide more specific instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer in the "source" view.
2. Make some changes to the XML.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message asking to save the changes.
5. The error message should provide clear options for saving or discarding the changes.
6. The dialog should be titled appropriately, not as an "Error".
